document.masterDocTitle: Species of the genus Galathea Fabricius, 1793 (Crustacea, Decapoda, Galatheidae) from the Indian and Pacific Oceans, with descriptions of 92 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Species of the genus Galathea Fabricius, 1793 (Crustacea, Decapoda, Galatheidae) from the Indian and Pacific Oceans, with descriptions of 92 new species

Galathea ohshimai
Miyake & Baba, 1967 a

, fig. 3 ( Palau , 10 m ).—

(Obi major and Talaud Islands, 6–10 m ).—

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined . Indonesia . East coast of Marsegu Island . Rumphius Expedition II,
18 January 1975
: 1 M 2.3 mm ( MNHN Ga 1159 ).
Coloration . Ground color of carapace, abdomen and pereopods reddish. White transverse band on base of rostrum. Distal portion of P 1 palm white. P 2–4 with diffuse whitish and reddish bands.

Remarks. We have not observed notable variations in the morphological characteristics of this species. However, the facial pterygostomian spine is minute or obsolescent in some specimens. The genetic divergences between
G. ohshimai
and all other sequenced related species are larger than 15.0% ( COI ), and 8.6 % ( 16 S rRNA) (
Tab. 1
).
Distribution . Palau , Hong Kong , Indonesia , Papua New Guinea , Australia (Queensland), Vanuatu , New Caledonia ; 0–48 m , in corals and rubble.
